IP_PART25_8_syn_1:
Ion Robotic Bronchoscopy.
- Target: 2.3 cm PET-avid RUL nodule.
- Radial EBUS confirmation.
- Biopsies obtained.
IP_PART25_8_syn_2: The Ion robotic system was utilized for navigational bronchoscopy. A PET-avid 2.3 cm nodule in the right upper lobe was localized, confirmed via radial EBUS, and biopsied transbronchially.
IP_PART25_8_syn_3: Billing 31627 (Nav), 31628 (Bx), 31654 (REBUS). Target is solitary 2.3 cm PET-avid nodule in RUL.
IP_PART25_8_syn_4:
Procedure:
1. Robot setup.
2. Nav to RUL nodule.
3. EBUS verification.
4. Biopsy performed.
5. Finish.
IP_PART25_8_syn_5: ion robotic case for the pet avid nodule in the rul 2.3 cm radial ebus saw it nicely took biopsies patient did fine.
IP_PART25_8_syn_6: Ion robotic navigational bronchoscopy with radial EBUS and transbronchial biopsies of a PET-avid 2.3 cm RUL nodule.
IP_PART25_8_syn_7:
[Indication]
PET-avid RUL nodule.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
Ion robotic nav. REBUS. TBBx 2.3 cm nodule.
[Plan]
Await results.
IP_PART25_8_syn_8: We performed an Ion robotic navigational bronchoscopy to biopsy a PET-avid 2.3 cm nodule in the RUL. We confirmed the location with radial EBUS before taking samples.
IP_PART25_8_syn_9: Robotic navigation via the Ion system allowed biopsy of the PET-avid RUL nodule. Radial EBUS confirmed the site.
